title: Chord: Diminished 7th in E (Shape: C)
content:
# Chord: Diminished 7th in E (Shape: C)

## Description
The Diminished 7th chord is a dissonant four-note chord made up of a root note, a minor third, a diminished fifth, and a diminished seventh. In this case, the Diminished 7th chord in E is played using the C shape which positions the root (E) on the 6th string.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: E
- Minor Third: G
- Diminished Fifth: Bb
- Diminished Seventh: Db

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Diminished 7th chord is often found in jazz, classical, and some forms of metal music due to its dissonant and unresolved quality. It creates tension and a sense of impending motion, making it a versatile chord used to add color and complexity to compositions.

## Songs
1. "Fascinating Rhythm" by George Gershwin
2. "Eleanor Rigby" by The Beatles (transition from Em to Edim7 in the chorus)
3. "Prelude to a Kiss" by Duke Ellington
